column3: Incoming request will go through a layer of user access controls processing before being forwarded to the controller to service the requests.
Historical data kept: 1 month as backup.
Driver ID and Bus number will be used for authentication

For regular login| info regarding staging will be returned to TMS. For replacement login| staging will already be updated with the latest trip info (ie| bus stops that have been passed would already be disabled)
Single Ticket or Group Ticket (multiple Single Ticket. Eg| if purchase in group of 5| 5 tickets will be printed)
For realtime updates| ticketing info will be sent to the server upon the trigger of next bus stop's arrival.
There are 3 possible situation to cater for when a bus is on its run. 1. Normal end to the trip; 2. Inspection (in the middle of a trip); 3. Breakdown/Accident.

There are 2 types of Breakdown: 1. bus breakdown; 2. hardware breakdown. When bus breakdown| SOP for replacemnet bus will be triggered. When hardwares breakdwon| the bus will operate in offline mode until the end of the trip.
When Bus breakdowns and cannot continue| Driver will end his trip via End Day (End Trip?) process.

1. TMS Breakdown: Driver manually sells tickets until the end of the trip (day?). 2. Printer Breakdown: Driver manually sells tickets until the end of the trip (day?). 3. GPS Breakdown: Driver manually update staging records in TMS.
